About Andris Nelsons Musicians Staff & Leadership History Archives Mission Press Annual Reports Jobs and Opportunities Learn Children & Families Students & Educators Adults Symphony Hall Online Exhibits Community Performances Partners Collaborations Support BSO Friends and Society Membership Ways to Give Planned Giving Galas & Flagship Events Donor Events Special Gifts Sponsors, Business Partners, and Advertising Volunteer Shop CDs and Digital Media Gift Certificates Donate Tickets & Events Tickets 2025-26 Season Subscriptions Special Ticket Opportunities Group Sales Gift Certificates Search Volunteer Join the Boston Symphony Orchestra Association of Volunteers (BSAV) and share in the pride of supporting one of the world's great orchestras. Your contribution of time and skills will help keep the music alive for generations to come. Volunteer Log In The BSO has relied on the assistance of volunteers for decades, but in 1984, a group of loyal and dedicated supporters of the BSO and Tanglewood first joined forces to ensure that all aspects of the BSO's many educational, service, and fundraising initiatives were top-notch. The Boston Symphony Association of Volunteers (BSAV) currently offers a broad spectrum of programs and activities that members may participate in depending on their areas of interest. Volunteers may choose to lead tours of historic Symphony Hall or the Tanglewood grounds, participate in special fundraising events, help patrons in the Symphony Shop or Tanglewood Gift Shops, or assist children as they discover the wonders of classical music at Youth Concerts and the ever-popular Instrument Playground. To become a volunteer, email bsav@bso.org with your contact information, and if you are interested in volunteering in Boston, at Tanglewood, or both. You will be emailed information, including an application to fill out and return. Interviews for Boston volunteers are in the late fall, and interviews for Tanglewood are in early June. Volunteers are required to serve 20 hours annually, and also to be a Friend of the Boston Symphony, Pops, or Tanglewood. If you wish to volunteer but find the $150 donation a financial hardship, please contact the Volunteer Office to request assistance. Volunteers are asked to join at least one volunteer project. Full project listings are available at the following links for Boston and Tanglewood . (Not all projects currently have openings.) In appreciation of your service as a volunteer, you will receive a wide array of benefits. We believe that music belongs to everyone, and we are committed to ensuring that each person is treated with dignity and respect. All are welcome to apply to the BSAV, and part of your responsibility as a volunteer will be to help create a welcoming and inclusive environment for all. Volunteer Opportunities Boston Volunteer Projects Archives - Provide support to BSO archivists in research and organization of historical materials. Café Flowers - Arrange/assist with flower arrangements for Symphony Café and various function spaces throughout the hall. Training is provided. Community Chamber Concerts - Greet and provide information to patrons during Friday afternoon Community Chamber Concerts and/or Sunday afternoon Community Chamber Concerts. Flowers/Hall Decorating - Assist with flowers and hall decorating for the holiday season, as well as the corporate Pops fundraisers. Host - Serve as an ambassador to the BSO through greeting patrons and answering patron questions. Instrument Playground Assistants and Demonstrators - Assist with children’s activities and/or instruments for hands-on demonstrations at Youth and Family Concerts, educational events, etc. Music Library – assist our music librarians with various tasks Photography – capture images of community, donor, volunteer events for BSO use in marketing and engagement Quarter Notes - Participate in the design and production of Quarter Notes, the BSAV’s quarterly in-house newsletter. Social Engagement - assisting the BSAV in creating and executing social and educative engagement opportunities for our volunteers; Thank You Calls – assist our development team through calling donors to thank them for recent gifts Tour Guides - Lead visitors (adult and/or youth groups) on behind-the-scenes tours of Symphony Hall. Training provided. Volunteer Applications - Process and track all volunteer inquiries, applications, and interviews for Tanglewood. Volunteer Emeritus – assist BSAV staff in engaging with our retired volunteers Tanglewood Volunteer Projects Brochure Distribution - Distribute Tanglewood brochures and program information to local businesses in the areas surrounding the Berkshires. Days in the Arts (DARTS) – assist BSO education staff with their summer day-camp for Berkshire County 8th grade students Exhibit Docents – educate and assist patrons in the Tappan House about the history of Tanglewood.  Help them to engage with the exhibit, as well as provide general information and wayfinding Gift Shop - Provide sales assistance to customers and Tanglewood patrons in the gift shops. Training provided . Host - Serve as a Tanglewood ambassador through greeting and assisting patrons. Rove the lawn and assist patrons with wayfinding and questions for popular concerts. Information Table - Answer patron questions and help patrons enter to win free concert tickets prior to Shed concerts. Mobile Ticketing Assistance – assist concert-goers with accessing their mobile tickets as well as general information and wayfinding Parking Host – assist concert-goers as they arrive on the grounds with wayfinding and general information Photography – capture images of community, donor, volunteer events for BSO use in marketing and engagement Quarter Notes - Participate in the design and production of Quarter Notes, the BSAV’s quarterly in-house newsletter. Social Engagement - assisting the BSAV in creating and executing social and educative engagement opportunities for our volunteers; Tanglewood for Families – assist patrons with instrument playground activities, lawn games, crafts. and other community/family initiatives as needed Tour Guides - Lead visitors (adult and/or youth groups) on a historic walking tour of the Tanglewood grounds. Training provided. Ushers - Assist patrons in finding seats inside performance venues or on the lawn. Serve as an ambassador to the BSO by greeting and assisting patrons. Training provided. Volunteer Applications - Process and track all volunteer inquiries, applications, and interviews for Tanglewood. Volunteer Emeritus – assist BSAV staff in engaging with our retired volunteers BSAV Board Members & Staff Boston Symphony Association of Volunteers Executive Committee Members Howie Arkans, Chair Melissa Riesgo, Vice-Chair, Boston Peter Geller, Vice-Chair, Tanglewood Lisa Mafrici, Secretary Co-Chairs, Boston Carol Brown, Giovanna Franchi, Elizabeth Michalak Co-Chairs, Tanglewood Margot Lee, Susan Murawczyk, Phyllis Pollack Liaisons, Tanglewood Ushers, Norma D’Oliveira Erin Asbury, Director of Volunteer Services Contact Information Volunteer Office Symphony Hall 301 Massachusetts Avenue Boston, MA 02115 Telephone: (617) 638-9390 Email: bsav@bso.org The Volunteer Office is pleased to respond to any questions about the BSAV or becoming a BSAV member. Already a Volunteer? Visit our BSAV Online Portal! Click here for BOD application and email to: tanglewooddirector@outlook.com Serving on the Board of Directors offers opportunities for expanding your network, exploring new professional skills ranging from budget management to personnel policies to investments, and ongoing professional development. Plus - it's rewarding to take a leadership role in protecting over 300 acres of land, and reaching over 35,000 people in seven counties of NY and PA! Members of our Board of Directors have the following responsibilities: attending Board Meetings, scheduled on the last Wednesday of the month at 8:00am joining and serving on at least one committee (more info below) remaining active, dues-paying members of Tanglewood, at the membership level of their choice attending the annual fundraiser, and selling tickets to their personal and professional networks advocating for the organization and being eager to talk to their friends, families, and communities about the work Tanglewood does Committees generally meet once a month for an hour, and meeting times vary depending on the schedules of the committee members.  Board members should plan for an average monthly commitment of about 2-4 hours preparing for Board meetings, reviewing minutes, and participating in committees, plus a significant annual time commitment in outreach and networking on behalf of Tanglewood - including attending and enjoying the annual fundraiser with your friends! Committees include: Fund Development, Board Development, Community Relations, Finance, Human Resources, Facilities and Trails and our Children's Trail, Twilight Fundraiser and Haunted Happenings Subcommittees. Curious about what duties a Board member has? Check out this overview from the New York State Charities Bureau : it covers questions to ask before joining, explains the legal duties of care, loyalty, and obedience, and more! 443 Coleman Ave. Elmira, NY 14903 | 9:0 0 am-4:00pm Tuesday-Friday, and Saturday 10:00am-4:00pm | (607) 732-6060 Powered by Wild Apricot Membership Software

About Us - Tanglewood Care Services Ltd Home About Us Our Visions & Values Environmental, Social & Governance Frequently Asked Questions Our Homes Abbey Wood Lodge, Ormskirk Avocet House, Boston Beeston Rise, Beeston Bingley Park, Bingley Cedar Falls, Spalding Cloverleaf, Lincoln Holbeach Meadows, Holbeach Humberston House, Humberston Hunters Creek, Boston Lindley Park, Huddersfield Meadows Park, Louth Mount Croft, Bromsgrove Richard House, Grantham Sandpiper, Alford Sleaford Hall, Sleaford Tanglewood, Horncastle Toray Pines, Coningsby Trafford Waters, Manchester Trent Bridge, West Bridgford York Manor, York Our Care Respite Care Residential Care Dementia Care Day Care Palliative Care Nursing Care Activities Work With Us News Contact Us Team portal Contact 01205 358888 Book a viewing 01205 358888 Home About Us Our Visions & Values Environmental, Social & Governance Frequently Asked Questions Our Homes Abbey Wood Lodge, Ormskirk Avocet House, Boston Beeston Rise, Beeston Bingley Park, Bingley Cedar Falls, Spalding Cloverleaf, Lincoln Holbeach Meadows, Holbeach Humberston House, Humberston Hunters Creek, Boston Lindley Park, Huddersfield Meadows Park, Louth Mount Croft, Bromsgrove Richard House, Grantham Sandpiper, Alford Sleaford Hall, Sleaford Tanglewood, Horncastle Toray Pines, Coningsby Trafford Waters, Manchester Trent Bridge, West Bridgford York Manor, York Our Care Respite Care Residential Care Dementia Care Day Care Palliative Care Nursing Care Activities Work With Us News Contact Us About Us Tanglewood Care Homes is an award winning care home organisation. We are well established, with over 30 years of experience across Lincolnshire, Nottinghamshire, Yorkshire and beyond, and are proud of our great reputation. We offer high-quality, individualised care, with the wishes and choices of our residents at the heart of everything we do. We pride ourselves on creating friendly, homely environments where our residents can enjoy their days interacting with our caring and compassionate team members. We strive to achieve the best outcomes for our residents, and will go the extra mile to support them to continue to be as active as possible and live the most fulfilling life that they possibly can. Meet the team We aim to promote independence and choice, caring for our residents just as they wish to be cared for by building a unique care package for each and every individual. Frequently Asked Questions Our Mission Provide high quality care for our residents, in safe and comfortable surroundings, always promoting independence and choice. Give the families of our residents peace of mind, reassurance and confidence in our service. Attract and retain the best team members, giving them the skills and career pathways they deserve. Work in partnership with all external agencies, building relationships that support our visions & values. Our Vision & Values Who We Are The Tanglewood team members make our care homes into great communities. From management, to the teams in care, catering, housekeeping & laundry, maintenance, lifestyles and administration, everyone unites with the collective goal of working together to serve our residents in their home away from home. A Personal Care Plan is devised for every resident, which is individually tailored to ensure the most comfortable transition to the next chapter of their life. Environmental, Social & Governance Why Choose Us Dining Experience Catering is provided on site by our fully trained catering team members. Menus are devised with the inclusion of the residents. Alternatives are always available in addition to the daily menu. We offer snacks and drinks 24 hours a day. The dining experience is extremely important to us, and we endeavour to deliver the same high-quality, nutritional experience, irrespective of the dietary requirements for each individual. Environment We strive to maintain the highest standards of cleanliness in our homes. We have a dedicated housekeeping team who care for our environment, ensuring it is spotlessly clean and fresh, whilst ensuring we meet required infection control standards as we go. Lifestyle Our dedicated Lifestyles Coordinators create a full activity programme , including meaningful sessions created to incorporate our residents’ choices and wishes. Some may prefer group activities or events, where others may prefer some one-to-one time or a trip out. Your feedback Regular resident and relative meetings take place within the home. Your feedback is so important to us, as it enables us to maintain and enhance our standards. We listen, but most importantly, we act on the feedback we receive. © Copyright Tanglewood Care Services Ltd 2025. In times of transition, we all need a place to stay, a place to call home. Why hassle with buying, moving, setting up and then having to move, store, sell or discard furniture when you are done with it, when you can rent furniture from CORT? Cost-effective, convenient and hassle-free, furniture rental is the smart, flexible alternative for times of transition. Ideal Short or Long-Term Solutions Whether you’re a corporate commuter, student, stager, or serving in the military, furniture rental is an ideal solution. From several months to several years and everything in between, CORT has the lease term options you need for your stay. Convenient & Personalized Personalize your own space by choosing your furniture by the room or by the piece. With CORT's Move-In Ready packages, a trained professional will pick furniture to match your needs and budget. Seriously Hassle-Free Your prompt, professional delivery includes a complete furniture package setup down to the last pillow, lampshade, or spoon. CORT Furniture Rental provides a furnished life without compromise or commitment. Features & Description of Tanglewood Village Located in the heart of West Warwick, Tanglewood Village Apartments offer the convenience of city-living while still being tucked away in a quiet, park-like setting. We are 5 minutes away from all major highways and shopping centers. Featuring recently renovated studios, one, two and three bedroom apartments* at reasonable prices. Experience apartment living on a whole new level and take a dip in the pool or break a sweat in our updated fitness center. Grab your neighbors and challenge each other to a game of tennis, pickleball, basketball or bocce ball. We have it all! Our professional on-site management team is dedicated to providing the best customer service in Rhode Island. Terms & Fees Short Term Lease: No Pet Policy Dogs Allowed: No Restricted Breed: No Cats Allowed: No Additional Fees and Policies ApartmentSearch.com provides property listings to help you explore rental options.  Pricing as listed is provided by the property management companies and is subject to change and should be considered base rent which may not include required fees or additional costs.  These fees can include administrative, trash, pest, parking, utilities, pets, insurance, security deposits, licenses or other situational fees.  Before signing a lease, it is strongly recommend you confirm all terms, fees, policies, disclosures and conditions with the property management company to avoid surprises and make an informed decision. Treetop Walkway About us Trail Maps Snakes and Ticks Visit Board of Directors Staff Newsletter Events Upcoming Events Twilight at Tanglewood Fundraiser Career Opportunities Volunteering and Internships Programs Program Pricing and Booking Team Building Library and Senior Center Programs Parties & Rentals Camps Membership & Support Membership Application Our Corporate Supporters Member-only Member Start-up Wish List Animal Sponsorship Donate Gift Planning Blog Posts Facility Rentals Shop Staff Elaine with Minerva ("Mini") the Cooper's Hawk Elaine Smith , Executive Director tanglewooddirector@outlook.com Joined us January 2003 Our Executive Director is Elaine Smith. In addition to being a bluebird expert, she is a visionary leader and has guided Tanglewood through a period of extraordinary growth. Elaine provides administrative leadership. Represents and is accountable to the Board of Directors and administers policies and procedures as set by the Board.  Leads the effort to secure financial support for programs.  Supervises Tanglewood employees and is responsible for timely completion of all reports, budgets, proposals, and other documents necessary for operation. Provides leadership in developing programs to address needs in outdoor and environmental education.  Elaine also provides leadership for Tanglewood Nature Center’s relations with government and community leaders, funding agencies, educational institutions, the media, civic and special interest groups, and the public . Deanna with Lucy, the Barred Owl Deanna O'Brian , Office Manager tanglewoodoffmgr@outlook.com Joined us February 2011 As Office Manager, Deanna oversees the daily operations and keeps us in line! She manages all financial transactions including payroll, invoicing, check and cash handling.  Maintains records of activities associated with Tanglewood, including membership, camp registrations and rentals.  She also maintains the office, gift shop and office supplies and handles routine correspondence , and is generally your best bet with any question you may have. Maggie with Zeus, the bearded dragon Maggie Groce- Volunteer Coordinator, Educator and Camp Director volunteer.tanglewood@gmail.com Joined us December 2019 Maggie came to work at Tanglewood after a position at Sea World Orlando - she traded sting rays for owls! Maggie coordinates volunteers, supervises interns, and handles the group/corporate volunteering opportunities. If you are interested in volunteering or applying for an internship, please email her! As educator, wh en she's not designing and curating STEAM and nature-based curriculum in the office, Maggie is out in the field, traveling across five counties with animal ambassadors in tow. Maggie writes curriculum in tandem with the other educators. As Camp Director, Maggie manages all aspects of our summer camps. She hires and supervises our seasonal staff and ensures that all our campers have a safe, fun, educational and nature-based summer! As educator, when she's not designing and curating STEAM and nature-based curriculum in tandem with the other educators, Maggie is out in the field, traveling across five counties with animal ambassadors in tow. Ryan, with Sophie the Great Horned Owl Ryan Donnelly- Lead Educator, Summer Camp Lead, Research Coordinator and Amphibian Curator educator.tanglewood@gmail.com Joined us August 2021 Ryan Donnelly is dedicated to fostering environmental education and research while ensuring the well-being of Tanglewood’s amphibians. As Lead Educator, Ryan develops and implements STEAM and FOSS curricula, teaching students of all ages across the Twin Tiers and Finger Lakes. He designs new educational programs, enhances existing curricula, and supports local after-school programs. Additionally, Ryan serves as a resource for environmental information and coordinates guest speakers for community events. Ryan facilitates research efforts at Tanglewood, acting as the primary contact for scientific inquiries and projects. He ensures that Tanglewood’s conservation practices align with the best strategies to support local wildlife, specializing in the study of wild plants and animals. He collaborates with the Summer Camp Director to develop engaging camp curricula and coordinate weekly activities, ensuring an enriching experience for campers. Ryan is also responsible for the care and well-being of Tanglewood’s amphibians, maintaining their habitats and overseeing their health.

Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+ Camping | Vero Beach, Florida Find Camping Create a Dyrt Alert Unlock PRO Benefits List Your Property More Join Sign In Find Camping More Review a Campground Add a Location Gift Cards Contests Magazine Advertise About Us Press Careers Support Near Me Open in App Find Camping Create a Dyrt Alert Unlock PRO Benefits List Your Property Camping Florida Vero Beach, FL Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+ Contact Campground Photos About Location Site Types Features Reviews Contact Get the App View Photos Roads Nature Buildings Facilities Unlock Planning Tools in App Save Add Review Share Location Established Camping Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+ 2 Reviews Do you own or manage this property? Claim Your Listing CAMPER SUMMARY PRESENTED BY Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+ is located near Vero Beach, Florida. The area features flat terrain with nearby beaches and coastal landscapes. Campers can explore attractions such as the McKee Botanical Garden and the Vero Beach Museum of Art, with temperatures typically ranging from 60°F in winter to 90°F in summer. Description RV sites offer full hooks ups with 30/ 50 amp electric. Sorry, self contained units only- maximum two vehicles per site-Tow vehicles limited to 6,500 lbs
We are an age restricted community, one occupant must be 55 years of age.
Grand children are welcome to visit, but limited to a 2 week stay. Most pets welcome. Many of our grass sites back onto 300 acre nature preserve, you'll get to see lots of our indigenous animals from eagles to the elusive Florida panther. Walk our nature trail, take part in our seasonal activities, or simply relax in our heated pool Pad sites offer more space paved RV pad and patio. A one block walk brings you to South Vero Mall with a supermarket, bank, places to eat and a public bus stop. Catch one of Indian River County's free buses to explore from the ocean and beach to the Indian River Mall
From the the stars to the sea there's a wealth of opportunities to enjoy winter where the tropics begin. Our Community borders on a 300 acre nature preserve, is close to the Indian River and Atlantic ocean. Eagles, egrets,herons, raccoons,armadillos, squirrels and ducks visit our lake. Bobcats and the illusive Florida panther make occasional appearances, Manatees and dolphins swim the Indian river. Want to interact with nature in a more rigorous way? Canoe, kayak rentals, fishing charters, boat ramps - are nearby. Book an airboat ride or seat on a nature tour of Indian River lagoon from Harbor Branch Oceanographic Institute, visit the Manatee Observation Center. Disney World, Sea World and Universal Studios are a little over 100 miles away. NASA's Cape Kennedy with rockets on display and a great museum  less than 90 miles. The Florida Keys are less than 200 miles away. A one block walk brings you to South Vero Mall with banks, a supermarket, places to dine and a public bus stop. Beach's, boardwalks and boat ramps are less than 5 miles away, the river less than a mile. Spend a lazy winter day walking around Vero Beach. Swim or laze in our heated pool, watch clouds waft across a tropical sky. Work on your suntan or sit in the shade of the pool deck umbrellas. Use the free WIFI or borrow a book from the library in the clubhouse. Read More Suggest an Edit Location Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+ is located in Florida Directions Located 10 miles from Sebastian and 15 milesfrom Ft Pierce. From I-95 take the Vero Beach Exit (Exit 147) and go east to light at 82nd Ave. Turn R (S) onto 9th St/Oslo Rd and go to flashing light at end of the road. Turn L (E) and continue on to the light at US Hwy 1. Turn R (S) into the far left lane and take an immediate L turn (E) into the park. According to TheDyrt.com, Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+ has 50 amp electric hookups, water hookups and sewer hookups. What is the elevation of Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+? Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+ is located at 8 feet. What is the max vehicle length at Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+? Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+ allows vehicles up to 40 feet. Are fires allowed at Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+? Does Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+ have wifi? Yes, according to campers on TheDyrt.com, Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+ does have wifi. Is there cell phone reception at Tanglewood Village Co-Op 55+? According to campers on TheDyrt.com, there is good coverage for AT&T, excellent coverage for T-Mobile, and good coverage for Verizon. I agree to the privacy policy Tanglewood Care Home Search Your location Search radius 10 mi 25 mi 50 mi 100 mi 200 mi 500 mi Results 25 50 75 100 Meet Our Team Daniel Rowark- Donowa CEO With 25 years in social care and positively challenging the idea of what a care home is, Daniel aims to get to know each and every resident, their families and friends, to create a home that truly embraces the ideas, thoughts, feelings and wishes of everyone who lives there. Mark McDonald Chief Operating Officer With extensive experience working in senior roles across social care, Mark embraces the opportunity to make a meaningful difference to all the team members he works alongside to create teams with a shared passion for high-quality care. Adele Gavaghan Director of Regulation With over a decade in the care sector, Adele has risen from care assistant to Home Manager, before pursuing a regulatory career with CQC. Her personal experience with dementia fuels her passion for dementia care, end-of-life care, and workforce wellbeing. She is dedicated to creating a unique resident experience and challenging care norms with her team. Claire Rudd Learning and Development Manager Claire has 30 years of experience in Health and Social Care, including roles as a Care Manager. She is passionate about learning and development, believing that a well-trained team is the key to delivering excellent care. Outside of work, Claire enjoys spending time at the coast with her two Patterdale Terriers, Luna and Eddie, and her partner. Mark Newton Regional Quality Support Manager Mark started his care career at a very early age as a young carer for multiple family members from the age of 9. Later Mark went on to work in multiple settings in different roles within the care sector. Mark's passion is person-centred care for all residents and aims to make all including residents, relatives and team members feel truly valued daily. Katie More Regional Quality Support Manager Katie joined Tanglewood in 2017 and became Cloverleaf's home manager in December 2020. With 12 years of experience in health and social care, including nine in leadership, she has completed NVQ levels 2, 3, 5, and a DipHE in Social Sciences. Katie focuses on a person-centred approach, aiming to create a warm, welcoming community for all residents. © Copyright Tanglewood Care Services Ltd 2025. BOARD & STAFF The affairs of the Tanglewood Homes Association ("THA") is governed by a Board of Directors. Each Director must be a member, property owner, of Tanglewood. The Board of Directors is comprised of nine (9) members. A class of three (3) new Directors are elected to the Board each year serving a three-year (3) term. 2025 Board of Directors ​ Paige Cokinos-President Richard Anderson Linda Burdine Dion Cornett Steven Cope Laura Kelsey David Peterman George Robertson George Smith Officers Paige Cokinos President Steven Cope Vice President of Finance and Treasurer ​ Richard Anderson Vice President of Risk Management and Secretary (Legal/Insurance) Laura Kelsey Vice President of Compliance (Deed Restrictions) ​ David Peterman Vice President of Operations (Grounds/Garbage/Security) ​ ​ Finance Committee Richard Anderson Steven Cope David Peterman Staff Steven Boyd General Manager stevenboyd@tanglewoodhomes.org Margie Prather Administrative Assistant margieprather@tanglewoodhomes.org Taylor Neeb Maintenance Craig Frazzini Patrol Supervisor cbfrazzini@gmail.com ﻿﻿© 2023 Tanglewood Homes Association, Inc. bottom of page
